title: Is there a market for novellas? - Quora

response.answer_text: Sure. Amazon sells books of all lengths, even single short stories. Or take a page from Robert E. Howard. Throw 2 or 3 novelettes in under one cover or 1 novelette in with enough short stories, and you have a full length novel. Take a look at what Morgan Blayde did with a bunch of short stories, bridging them in such a way as to create a full length work in his awesome Agent X novel. Amazon.com: Agent X eBook: MORGAN BLAYDE: Kindle Store

Y and N. My agent says no to less than 70k words for fiction, but he only works in mass-market. University and indies might bite--a friend recently published one with Peasantry Press, for instance--but their standards tend to be extraordinarily high, even for genre work, because they have less of an option of playing shotgun approach with their books.
